Job Title: Finance Area Lead

Location: Free Home, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Who We Are

For more than 40 years, Covanta has been at the forefront of sustainable materials management, providing companies and communities world-class waste and resource solutions.

Through our diverse and scalable full-service capabilities, we’re leading the charge to a carbon-negative future—reducing, reusing, recycling and reimagining waste for the benefit of both people and planet.

Our differentiator comes from our vast ecosystem of technology, facilities, and partnerships, trusted by the world’s largest organizations to solve their most pressing environmental challenges, and achieve their most ambitious environmental, social, and governance (ESG) goals .

All that we’re missing is you. Join us today!!

Our values

Diversity, inclusivity, engagement—these are the values that help us foster a strong sense of community within Covanta. By embracing the unique talents, perspectives, and experiences of our employees, we cultivate an environment that embraces teamwork, encourages open dialogue, and provides opportunities for growth.

About The Role

Finance Area Lead- South Region

This position is Remote based out of Atlanta GA or Sumter SC.

This is a unique leadership opportunity to be a part of a dynamic finance team as well as to interact with regional leaders, Facility and Area Managers to further develop Business Decision Support and FP&A capabilities for the South Region in Environmental Services.

This is a key role within the Regional Finance Organization directly reporting to the Senior Finance Director of Operations, Environmental Services. The Area Finance Lead has direct responsibility to support and lead the Decision Support processes for Operations and Commercial Finance, FP&A Processes including forecasting, budget, long range plan and monthly reporting activities and as well as to serve as the main contact for the Shared Service Center to coordinate all reporting activities with the Facility Senior Management Team monthly. The role involves providing financial planning support to the Sr Finance Director of Operation – ES, Regional CFO, Facility Managers, area assets managers and Regional Chief Operating Officer (COO).

This position supports the Facilities and oversees functional cost centers, drive FP&A and management reporting process for all facilities under its responsibility, annual budget plan, forecasting, outlooks (weekly pulse, financial estimates), Long Range Plan (LRP) and will improve and standardize reporting tools across the facilities and the south region. This position will have extended responsibility to oversee monthly reporting activities performed under US generally accepted accounting (US GAAP) principles, internal policies, SOX and procedures.

The Area Finance Lead will be an integral team member of Covanta’s South Region Finance team and will provide support to prepare financial executive level presentations and will support scenario planning and sensitive analysis when required.

Partner with the facility/Regional management in achieving business objectives including financial, operational and commercial. Support Facility Managers, Area Managers, Commercial Organization, Asset Managers, COO, Chief Commercial Officer and Region Leaders to perform contract reviews, commercial proposals and scenario planning. Partner with Shared Service Center Organization (SSC) to ensure timely reporting of financial statements for all facilities under his/her responsibility are performed in compliance with US generally accepted accounting (US GAAP) principles, internal policies, SOX and procedures. Interact with Internal and external auditors to coordinate facilities and SSC to prepare and deliver all documentation required for internal and external audits. Support Sr Finance Director of Operations, Regional FP&A and partner with Corporate FP&A as well as Shared Service Center teams to ensure timely, accurate and insightful financial analysis that allow to monitor business KPIs (including collections / account receivables) and enable effective decision making. Monitor, analyze, and report on consolidated regional performance against budget and prior year including financial walk across and bridges to generate insightful analytics for price and volume analytics. Perform operational statistical and metrics tracking, evaluate financial performance comparing actual results to plans while also making recommendations to obtain goals. Provides financial support in delivering monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reporting to monitor targets versus budget and long-term plan. Evaluate financial and operation performance (operational statistical and metrics tracking) and make recommendations to obtain goals. Includes preparing financial reporting packages and explanations. Develop new analysis views to assist in analyzing financial performance, KPIs, etc., including any special projects and ad hoc request as assigned and required. Partner with facility managers, regional leaders in forecasting and analyzing regional department overhead costs. Support Sr Finance Director of Operations - ES, Regional FP&A, Commercial Finance and Regional CFO to develop systems and processes to support Region’s ability to forecast and budget to meet internal business needs as well as corporate planning requirements including:Partner with commercial organization to help enhance process to analyze, manage and report revenue results, forecast, and opportunities. Partner with key stakeholders across the facilities & region to develop forecasts and budgets, as well as with accounting teams to deliver monthly closing processes. Support Region to ensure facility, regional and corporate submissions are met on a timely basis. Ensure that supporting data and analysis is relevant and accurate. Support to raise the capabilities of ES finance team to become a trusted/value added business partner. Deliver expense analytics to support cost management allocation, expense reduction and support to improve budget and forecast accuracy. Partner with Facility Managers and Regional leaders in forecasting, budgetingParticipate in weekly morning meeting for each facility under his/her responsibility as well as visit each facility on monthly basis (as per business needs or minimum once per month)

Education and Desire Experience:

Bachelor’s Degree in finance, Administration, Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field. CPA or MBA is a plus. 8+ years or equivalent experience in Finance Commercial, Finance FP&A, Finance Supply Chain, Plant Controller. Project modeling and scenario planning is a plus. Ability to interpret and adhere to contractual language. Direct report to Senior Finance Leaders or Regional CFOs in positions supporting regional organizations. Other Experiences: Product P&L, regional HQ, G&A expenses, cost control, process improvement and standardization. 

Essential Skills and Competencies:

Accountability, Collaboration, eager to learn, drive by results, manage ambiguity, self-management, self-motivated, critical thinking, and strong business acumen. Strong analytical ability to understand impact of financials changes and support to prepared corrective actions. Ability to deliver high quality work under pressure of tight deadlines. Strong interpersonal and presentation skills and ability to build a strong network across the organization. Ability to work with a range of functionally diverse peoples, influencing them to get things done, and delivering value added business results that meet high quality requirements within deadlines. Strong knowledge on Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and/or Enterprise Performance Management (EPM): JDEdwards EnterpriseOne (Oracle), SAP, Cognos, Hyperion, CAFE, Tableau BI, SmartView. 

Physical Demands:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be regularly required to stand, sit, talk, hear, reach, stoop, kneel, and use hands and fingers to operate a computer, telephone, and keyboard.

Our DEI Commitment

Covanta is an Equal Opportunity Employer, has developed an Affirmative Action Program (AAP), and will not discriminate against any qualified applicants because of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability (including perceived disability, physical, mental, and/or intellectual disabilities), veteran status, liability for service in the Armed Forces of the United States, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Know Your Rights (Click to view poster)

Please note that Level, Title and/or Salary may be adjusted based on the applicant's experience or skills.

If you are an individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to access job openings or apply for a job on this site because of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by going to Covanta.com and clicking on the ‘Contact Us’ button. Under Inquires, select ‘Careers’ in the Interest field, fill out all required fields including your message. In the message section, please note this is a ‘Job Application Accommodation Request’.

Experience Level (if available): None
